abstract: Joseph D'Angeli, director of Wildlife Conservation and Education Center in Ridgefield Park, NJ, has created Batstock, annual series of events in Bergen County aimed at celebrating bats; events seek to educate public about important part of ecosystem whose falling numbers, in part because of white-nose syndrome, could lead to jump in insect populations.
lead_paragraph: Batstock is an annual series of events in Bergen County created by Joseph D’Angeli, who is known in some quarters as the Batman of New Jersey.
snippet: Batstock is an annual series of events in Bergen County created by Joseph D’Angeli, who is known in some quarters as the Batman of New Jersey....

headline.main: Crusader Without a Cape Sends Out the Bat Signal in New Jersey
headline.print_headline: A Crusader,  Capeless,  Sends Out a Bat Signal
